musicalLanguage.description: The iconic synthesizer riff adapted for piano. Pete Townshend's pulsing, repetitive arpeggio was originally created on a Lowrey organ with a sequencer. This piano arrangement captures the hypnotic, driving quality of the riff, cycling through F and Bb with relentless eighth-note energy.
musicalLanguage.structure: Riff (8 bars) — F major arpeggiated pattern with Bb and C chord variations
keyMoments: Bars 1-4: The hypnotic F major riff — pure rhythmic energy building through repetition
Bars 5-6: Bb chord variation — the harmony shifts while the rhythmic pattern continues
Bars 7-8: C to F resolution — the riff completes its cycle with a satisfying cadence
teachingGoals: Rapid arpeggiated patterns at a brisk tempo
Maintaining energy and evenness across repeated patterns
Adaptation of synthesizer patterns for piano technique
styleTips: Play with mechanical precision — this was originally a sequenced synth pattern
Every note should be exactly the same volume and length — uniformity is the aesthetic
The left hand should anchor solidly while the right hand drives the pattern

measures.rightHand: C4:e F4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e F4:e C4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: F major arpeggio — the driving riff begins. Keep it absolutely even.

measures.rightHand: C4:e F4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e F4:e C4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: Same pattern — repetition is the point. Lock into the groove.

measures.rightHand: C4:e F4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e F4:e C4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: F major continues — the hypnotic quality builds with each repeat.

measures.rightHand: C4:e F4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e F4:e C4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: Four bars of the same riff — you should be in a trance by now. That is the intention.

measures.rightHand: D4:e F4:e Bb4:e D5:e Bb4:e F4:e D4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: Bb major — the same rhythmic pattern but the notes shift to Bb chord. A harmonic breath.

measures.rightHand: D4:e F4:e Bb4:e D5:e Bb4:e F4:e D4:e F4:e
measures.teachingNote: Bb continues — the contrast with F makes the return even more powerful.

measures.rightHand: C4:e E4:e G4:e C5:e G4:e E4:e C4:e E4:e
measures.teachingNote: C major — the V chord. Energy building toward the final resolution.

measures.rightHand: C4:e F4:e A4:e C5:e A4:e F4:q.
measures.teachingNote: Back to F — the riff completes its cycle. The last note holds slightly longer for closure.
